history.content: Yes -- if you do that, your grade in 70 will be used to determine whether you meet the GPA cutoff for declarations. You should declare one first, then fill out the double major request form with your intended 4-year schedule and submit it to Evans or online (depending which one you declare first).

<md>I am an intended major in Applied Mathematics and Computer Science but I applied to Berkeley with a major in the Physical and Mathematical Sciences Department. I have been hearing a lot about the CS70 enrolment cut and that an undeclared major, such as me, will probably not be able to take the class. I am hoping that in such a scenario, I can take Math 55 and then declare both my majors. Will I be allowed to do that? If yes, what would the process be?</md>
history.subject: CS 70 enrolment from next semester
